intro: Paraspalathus albanensis, commonly known as the Albanian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of this family. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Paraspalathus albanensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
